intro: Mendoncia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan mendoncia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
